column1: Miryalaguda is a city in Nalgonda district of the Indian state of Telangana. In 2015
column2: the Government of India placed Miryalaguda under the Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation scheme. It is located about 44 kilometres (27 mi) from the district headquarters Nalgonda
column3: 142 kilometres (88 mi) from the state capital Hyderabad.

column1: Miryalaguda is located at 16.8667°N 79.5833°E﻿ / 16.8667; 79.5833. It has an average elevation of 105 metres (344 ft).
TSRTC operates buses from Miryalaguda to various destinations like Hyderabad
The railway station is situated on the Pagidipalli–Nallapadu section section in Guntur Division. The rail was an electrified
column2: single line. State highway 2 passes through Miryalaguda. It was electrified in 2018-19. Pagidipalli-Nallapadu was electrified in 2019. The electric trains started service on 1 September 2019.
